gurmukhi: rwiDkw cMdRBgw muK cMd su Kylq hY imil Kyl sbY ] imil suMdr gwvq gIq Bly su bjwvq hY kr qwl qbY ]
transliteration: Raadhika Channdrabhagad Moukh Channd Su Khelat Hai Mil(i) Khel Soubai|| Mil(i) Soundar Gadvat Geet Bhale Su Bajaavat Hai Kar Taal Tabai||
translation: Radha, Chandarbhaga and Chandarmudhi all are singing together and absorbed in amorous sport;

gurmukhi: Pun iqAwg sBY sur mMfl ko sB kauqk dyKq dyK sBY ] Ab rwkS mwrn kI su kQw kCu QorI AhY sun lyhu AbY ]645]
transliteration: Phoun Tiaag Sabhai Sur Mandal Ko Sabh Kaoutak Dekhat Dekh Sabhai|| Ab Raakash Maaran Kisu Kathaa Kachh(u) Thoriahai Soun Lehu Abai||645||
translation: The gods are also seeing this wonderful play, leaving their abodes; now listen to the short story about the killing of the demon.645.

gurmukhi: nwcq QI ijh gÍwrnIXw jh PUl iKry Aru Baur guMjwrYN ] qIr bhY jmunw jh suMdr kwnH hlI imil gIq aucwrYN ]
transliteration: Naachat Thijih Gvaarneeyaa Jah Phool Khire Ar(u) Bhaur Gounjdarain|| Teer Bahai Jamounnda Jah Soundar Kaahn Halimil(i) Geet Ouchdarain||
translation: The place, where the gopis were dancing, the flowers had blossomed there and the black bees were humming, the river together singing a song;

gurmukhi: Kyl krY Aiq hI ihq so n kCU mn BIqr SMkih DwrYN ] rIJ kibq pVY rs ky bhsY doaU Awhs mY nhI hwrYN ]646]
transliteration: Khel Darai At(i) Hihit So Na Kachhodh Man Bheetar Shankah(i) Dhdarain|| Reejh Kabit Padai Ras Ke Bahsai Dooo Aahas Mai Nahihdarain||646||
translation: They were playing there fearlessly and affectionately and both of them were not accepting defeat from each other in reciting poetry etc.646.

gurmukhi: AQ j`KC goipn kO nB ko ly aufw ]
transliteration: Ath Jakkhachh Gopin Kau Nabh Ko Le Udaa||
translation: Now beings the description of the Yaksha flying with gopis in the sky

gurmukhi: Awvq Qo iek j`KC bfo ieh rws ko kauqk qwih iblokXo ] gÍwrin dyiK kY mYn bFXo iqh qy qn mY nhI rMck rokXo ]
transliteration: Oovat Tho Ik Jakkhachh Bado Eh Raas Kaoutak Taah(i) Bilokyo Gvaaran(i) Dekh(i) Kai Main Badhyo Tih Te Tan Mai Nahiranchak Rokyo||
translation: A Yaksha came and he saw this wonderful play; seeing the gopis he became lustful and could not restrain himself a little;

gurmukhi: gÍwrin lY su clXo niB kO iknhU iqh BIqr qy nhI tokXo ] ijau miD BIqir lY muslI hir kyhru hY miRg so irpu rokXo ]647]
transliteration: Gvaaran(i) Lai Su Chadyo Nabh(i) Kau Kinhoo Tih Bheetar Te Nahitokyo|| Jio Madh(i) Bheetar(i) Lai Mouslihar(i) Kehar(u) Hai Mrig So Rip(u) Rokyo||647||
translation: He flew in the sky, taking the gopis with him, without any opposition; Balram and Krishna obstructed him at the same time like a lion obstructing a deer.647.

gurmukhi: j`KC ky sMg ikDO muslI hir ju`Du krXo Aiq kopu sMBwrXo ] lY qr bIr doaU kr BIqr BIm Bey Aiq hI bl DwrXo ]
transliteration: Jakkhachh Ke San Kidhau Mouslihar(i) Juddh(u) Daryo At(i) Kop(u) Sanbhdaryo|| Lai Tar Beer Dooo Kar Bheetar Bheem Bhae At(i) Hibal Dhdaryo||
translation: Highly infuriated Balram and Krishna waged a war with that Yaksha; both the brave warriors, assuming strength like Bhim, fought, taking the trees in their hands;

gurmukhi: dYq pCwr lXo ieh BwNq kbY jsu qw Cib AYs aucwrXo ] Foky Cuty qy mhwN CuDvwn ikDo crvw auiT bwjih mwrXo ]648]
transliteration: Dait Pachhaad Layo Eh Bhaant Kabai Jas(u) Taa Chhab(i) Ais Ouchdaryo|| Dhoke Chhoute Te Mahaan Chhudhvaan Kidho Chakvaa Outh(i) Baajah(i) Mdaryo||648||
translation: In this way, they overpowered the demon; this spectacle appeared like a hungry falcon, pouncing upon arcane and killing him.648.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry goip Curwiebo jKC bDh ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Karishnaavatdare Gop(i) Chhudaae-bo Jakhachh Badhah||
translation: End of the description of “The abduction of Gopi and killing of Yaksha” in Krishnavtara in Baachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: mwr kY qwih ikDO muslI hir bMsI bjweI n kY kCu SMkw ] rwvn Kyq mrXo kup kY ijn rIJ BBICn dIn su lMkw ]
transliteration: Maar Kai Taah(i) Kidhau Mouslihar(i) Bansibajaaina Kai Kachh(u) Shankaa|| Raavan Khet Daryo Koup Kai Jin Reejh Bhabheechhan Deen Su Lankaa||
translation: Krishna and Balram played on their fluted after killing the Yaksha; Krishna had killed Ravana in rage and had given the kingdom of Lanka to Vibhishna;
